author: sauliusgrigaitis
content: Not Pectra interop related, but a general interop - is it OK to ignore the unspec'ed parameters sent to beacon node API? Lodestar VC sends `fee_recipient` when calling https://ethereum.github.io/beacon-APIs/#/Validator/produceBlockV3, however, Grandine only accepts requests according to the specification. <@792822129019584562> https://discord.com/channels/945714351841607690/945714351841607694/1225769314649636914

author: sauliusgrigaitis
content: My suggestion would be to not send unspec'ed parameters by default (turn on with flag if it's necessary) because accepting unspec'ed parameters smells undefined behaviour.

author: stefanbratanov
content: Yeah, I think by default, unspec'ed params should be ignored, some VC -> BN combos may send/accept additional ones but it is up to them to document that certain VC calls are only compatible with certain BN

author: sauliusgrigaitis
content: I see. So you don't see an issue that VC sends unspec'ed parameters and BN just ignores those fields? At Grandine we actually error. Is there any client that errors when it receives unspec'ed parameters?

author: sauliusgrigaitis
content: I see a problem when somebody requests BN something and part of the request is just ignored and VC even don't know it.

author: barnabasbusa
content: Nimbus also throws an error

author: barnabasbusa
content: https://github.com/ChainSafe/lodestar/issues/6636

author: stefanbratanov
content: It's a tricky one, a VC could start sending a new optional field before another BN implements support for it. In that case, do we want the BN to fail to indicate this or proceed as usual just ignoring this field? It's up to clients how they want to handle these compatibility issues that can occur.

author: sauliusgrigaitis
content: failing on BN helps to debug, meanwhile, VC could just have this feature optional via CLI flag.

author: sauliusgrigaitis
content: I don't like that BN just ignores unknown field, but I'm maybe just too strict here.

author: g11tech
content: we send the params which the beacon can perfectly ignore because we added the params considering the other BNs might not apply it, this is to activate extra behavior for lodestar BN

author: g11tech
content: so, we interpret the respnse to see if the params were respected or not (so lodestar BN will respond with extra metadata) which the lodestar VC will be able to understand, and a non lodestar VC doesn't need to bother because it wouldn't have asked for non default (spec complaint) response anyway
